sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph with 7 vertices: 

Graph image: https://imgur.com/5e5yg5N

Find the Hamiltonian cycle in the graph.
message_2:
A Hamiltonian cycle is a closed loop on a graph where every node (vertex) is visited exactly once.

Based on the graph provided in the link, one Hamiltonian cycle can be represented as follows:

1 → 2 → 3 → 7 → 5 → 4 → 6 → 1

This cycle visits each vertex exactly once and returns to the starting vertex, satisfying the conditions of a Hamiltonian cycle.
